page.title: 14ADULT LITERACY IN MIDHURST
page.content: The scale of the adult literacy problem in Midhurst corresponds with the national average and free, confidential tuition is available to those who require it.Tutors are unpaid volunteers who teach only 1 student at a time.They are specially trained and can teach reading,spelling and basic English.If a student wants to read a motorcycle manual the tutor must learn about the topic.Lessons are once a week and can be at the home of the tutor or student or any other place of their choice.Whip Hill in Midhurst is the local headquarters for the Adult Literacy Scheme.They also teach handicapped people who want to improve their literary skills.There is no set course.It is up to the student to tell the tutor which of the literary skills he wishes to acquire or improve.
